rev.comment: rm non-free screenshots per [[WP:NFLISTS]]. These are minor characters. Non-free imagery is not necessary.

â
| style="background:white" colspan="4" | [[Image:LeeBergere-JosephAnders.jpg|thumb|right|Original cast member Bergere as Joseph]]
+
| style="background:white" colspan="4" |
As ''Dynasty'' begins, the [[Carrington family|Carringtons']] longtime [[majordomo (domestic staff)|majordomo]] Joseph is fiercely loyal to the family and takes an immediate dislike to [[Blake Carrington]]'s new bride [[Krystle Carrington|Krystle]]. Krystle rises to the challenge and they eventually share a mutual respect. Joseph later shows a deeper loathing for [[Alexis Colby|Alexis]], Blake's first wife, which is later exacerbated by Alexis' ill treatment of Joseph's daughter, [[Kirby Anders|Kirby]]. At the end of Season Three, Alexis and Krystle are trapped in a cabin that is then set on fire; they survive, and it is eventually revealed that Joseph had set the fire in an effort to kill Alexis after she had threatened to disclose a secret related to Kirby's parentage. After learning this, Blake drives to Joseph's home but is too late, as the guilty Joseph has killed himself by way of a self-inflicted gunshot wound.
As ''Dynasty'' begins, the [[Carrington family|Carringtons']] longtime [[majordomo (domestic staff)|majordomo]] Joseph is fiercely loyal to the family and takes an immediate dislike to [[Blake Carrington]]'s new bride [[Krystle Carrington|Krystle]]. Krystle rises to the challenge and they eventually share a mutual respect. Joseph later shows a deeper loathing for [[Alexis Colby|Alexis]], Blake's first wife, which is later exacerbated by Alexis' ill treatment of Joseph's daughter, [[Kirby Anders|Kirby]]. At the end of Season Three, Alexis and Krystle are trapped in a cabin that is then set on fire; they survive, and it is eventually revealed that Joseph had set the fire in an effort to kill Alexis after she had threatened to disclose a secret related to Kirby's parentage. After learning this, Blake drives to Joseph's home but is too late, as the guilty Joseph has killed himself by way of a self-inflicted gunshot wound.
Line 86: Line 86:
| align="center"| "[[The Siege - Part 2 (Dynasty)|The Siege - Part 2]]"

â
| style="background:white" colspan="4" | [[Image:BoHopkins-MatthewBlaisdel.jpg|thumb|right|Original cast member Hopkins as Matthew (1981)]]
+
| style="background:white" colspan="4" |
[[Krystle Carrington|Krystle Jennings]]' former flame and a Denver-Carrington employee, Matthew returns to [[Denver, Colorado|Denver]] from the [[Middle East]] on the eve of Krystle's marriage to [[Blake Carrington]]. He struggles with his feelings for Krystle as he tries to rebuild his marriage with fragile [[Claudia Blaisdel Carrington|Claudia]], newly released from an institution after a breakdown. Matthew leaves Blake's employ to run his own rig, and soon their rivalry over Krystle transforms into a fierce rivalry over oil. Meanwhile, Claudia's friendship with Blake's son [[Steven Carrington]] turns into an affair; when the secret comes out, Matthew takes his and Claudia's daughter [[Lindsay Blaisdel|Lindsay]] and leaves town. They are later presumed dead in a car crash in the jungles of [[Peru]].
[[Krystle Carrington|Krystle Jennings]]' former flame and a Denver-Carrington employee, Matthew returns to [[Denver, Colorado|Denver]] from the [[Middle East]] on the eve of Krystle's marriage to [[Blake Carrington]]. He struggles with his feelings for Krystle as he tries to rebuild his marriage with fragile [[Claudia Blaisdel Carrington|Claudia]], newly released from an institution after a breakdown. Matthew leaves Blake's employ to run his own rig, and soon their rivalry over Krystle transforms into a fierce rivalry over oil. Meanwhile, Claudia's friendship with Blake's son [[Steven Carrington]] turns into an affair; when the secret comes out, Matthew takes his and Claudia's daughter [[Lindsay Blaisdel|Lindsay]] and leaves town. They are later presumed dead in a car crash in the jungles of [[Peru]].

â
| style="background:white" colspan="4" | [[File:WayneNorthrop-MichaelCulhane.jpg|thumb|right|Original cast member Northrop as Michael (1981)]]
+
| style="background:white" colspan="4" |
As ''Dynasty'' begins, [[Carrington family|Carrington]] chauffeur Michael becomes involved in a sexual relationship with heiress [[Fallon Carrington Colby|Fallon]], but she soon turns the tables on his playful blackmail attempt. Michael proves useful to [[Blake Carrington]] in his shady business dealings, but Blake has Michael beaten up when he learns of his relationship with Fallon. Michael leaves town at the end of the first season, but returns in the first episode of the seventh season ("[[The Victory (Dynasty)|The Victory]]") in time to save [[Amanda Carrington]] from the La Mirage fire. The two become romantically involved as Blake gives Michael his job as Blake's driver back, but Blake fires him when he sees the couple kissing. An angry Michael, not really as poor as he has let on, secretly orchestrates a deal that would give him a piece of Blakes latest venture; Amanda's mother [[Alexis Colby]] reveals his schemes, and he soon leaves [[Denver, Colorado|Denver]] again.
As ''Dynasty'' begins, [[Carrington family|Carrington]] chauffeur Michael becomes involved in a sexual relationship with heiress [[Fallon Carrington Colby|Fallon]], but she soon turns the tables on his playful blackmail attempt. Michael proves useful to [[Blake Carrington]] in his shady business dealings, but Blake has Michael beaten up when he learns of his relationship with Fallon. Michael leaves town at the end of the first season, but returns in the first episode of the seventh season ("[[The Victory (Dynasty)|The Victory]]") in time to save [[Amanda Carrington]] from the La Mirage fire. The two become romantically involved as Blake gives Michael his job as Blake's driver back, but Blake fires him when he sees the couple kissing. An angry Michael, not really as poor as he has let on, secretly orchestrates a deal that would give him a piece of Blakes latest venture; Amanda's mother [[Alexis Colby]] reveals his schemes, and he soon leaves [[Denver, Colorado|Denver]] again.

Line 331: Line 331:
| align="center"| "[[The Letter (Dynasty)|The Letter]]"
| align="center"| "[[The Letter (Dynasty)|The Letter]]"
|-
|-
â
| style="background:white" colspan="4" | [[Image:Caress.jpg|thumb|O'Mara as Caress]]
+
| style="background:white" colspan="4" |
The younger sister of [[Alexis Colby]], Caress is released from a [[Caracas]], [[Venezuela]] prison in 1986; she had been incarcerated years before after an incident involving Alexis and her then-paramour, [[Zach Powers]]. Caress comes to [[Denver, Colorado|Denver]] and hopes to make a fortune by writing a scathing tell-all book about Alexis and exposing her sister's darkest secrets. Alexis finds out about the book, secretly buys the publishing company and scuttles the project. A resentful Caress offers to help Alexis' ex-husband [[Blake Carrington]] prove that Alexis [[perjury|perjured]] herself in a court case against him. Blake's brother [[Ben Carrington]] has Caress kidnapped and sent back to prison in Caracas; she sends a desperate letter to Blake, but he is unable to free her because of Ben's bribes. Blake sends Alexis' ex-husband [[Dex Dexter]] (joined by [[Clay Fallmont]]) to extract her. Once back in Denver, Caress blackmails [[Emily Fallmont]] with the secret that Emily once cheated on her husband [[Buck Fallmont|Buck]] with Ben; Emily ultimately confesses her sins, but is hit by a car and killed. Caress leaves town on a mission to dig up secrets on Ben, but is never heard from again.
The younger sister of [[Alexis Colby]], Caress is released from a [[Caracas]], [[Venezuela]] prison in 1986; she had been incarcerated years before after an incident involving Alexis and her then-paramour, [[Zach Powers]]. Caress comes to [[Denver, Colorado|Denver]] and hopes to make a fortune by writing a scathing tell-all book about Alexis and exposing her sister's darkest secrets. Alexis finds out about the book, secretly buys the publishing company and scuttles the project. A resentful Caress offers to help Alexis' ex-husband [[Blake Carrington]] prove that Alexis [[perjury|perjured]] herself in a court case against him. Blake's brother [[Ben Carrington]] has Caress kidnapped and sent back to prison in Caracas; she sends a desperate letter to Blake, but he is unable to free her because of Ben's bribes. Blake sends Alexis' ex-husband [[Dex Dexter]] (joined by [[Clay Fallmont]]) to extract her. Once back in Denver, Caress blackmails [[Emily Fallmont]] with the secret that Emily once cheated on her husband [[Buck Fallmont|Buck]] with Ben; Emily ultimately confesses her sins, but is hit by a car and killed. Caress leaves town on a mission to dig up secrets on Ben, but is never heard from again.

Line 377: Line 377:
| align="center"| "[[Broken Krystle (Dynasty)|Broken Krystle]]"
| align="center"| "[[Broken Krystle (Dynasty)|Broken Krystle]]"
|-
|-
â
| style="background:white" colspan="4" |[[Image:LeannHunley-DanaWaring.jpg|thumb|right|Hunley as Dana]]
+
| style="background:white" colspan="4" |
[[Adam Carrington]] uses Dana, [[Blake Carrington|Blake]]'s beautiful and loyal assistant at Denver-Carrington, to obtain confidential information while working for his mother [[Alexis Colby|Alexis]] at ColbyCo. The pair soon fall in love, and it is revealed that Dana had followed Adam to [[Denver, Colorado|Denver]] from [[Billings, Montana|Billings]], [[Montana]], where she had loved him from afar. They marry, but Dana's inability to conceive a child places a strain on their relationship. She struggles to keep the secret that her infertility was caused by an abortion in her teens, the result of a one-night stand with Adam when he lived as Michael Torrance (he had been too drunk to remember the encounter). Adam and Dana use a surrogate to conceive Adam's child, but the subsequent custody battle when the mother changes her mind tears Adam and Dana's marriage apart for good.
[[Adam Carrington]] uses Dana, [[Blake Carrington|Blake]]'s beautiful and loyal assistant at Denver-Carrington, to obtain confidential information while working for his mother [[Alexis Colby|Alexis]] at ColbyCo. The pair soon fall in love, and it is revealed that Dana had followed Adam to [[Denver, Colorado|Denver]] from [[Billings, Montana|Billings]], [[Montana]], where she had loved him from afar. They marry, but Dana's inability to conceive a child places a strain on their relationship. She struggles to keep the secret that her infertility was caused by an abortion in her teens, the result of a one-night stand with Adam when he lived as Michael Torrance (he had been too drunk to remember the encounter). Adam and Dana use a surrogate to conceive Adam's child, but the subsequent custody battle when the mother changes her mind tears Adam and Dana's marriage apart for good.
